title: ESA seeks modest boost to science budget
summary:
The head of ESA’s science programs says she is seeking a “very modest” increase in her budget at ESA’s upcoming ministerial meeting to fund work on future missions.
The post ESA seeks modest boost to science budget appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Astronomers seek global ban on space advertising
summary:
Astronomers are calling on nations to ban advertising in space that can be seen from the ground, calling it the latest threat to the dark and quiet sky.
The post Astronomers seek global ban on space advertising appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: JWST facing potential cuts to its operational budget
summary:
While the James Webb Space Telescope continues to exceed astronomers’ expectations, it faces a potential funding shortfall.
The post JWST facing potential cuts to its operational budget appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: ESA Member States to Vote on Future of Space Rider in November
summary:
ESA Member States will decide on the future of the Space Rider programme during the agency’s Ministerial Council meeting in Bremen this November, Programme Manager Dante Galli told European Spaceflight. Space Rider is a reusable spacecraft designed to carry scientific and technology demonstration payloads to orbit and return them to Earth, using a parafoil for […]
The post ESA Member States to Vote on Future of Space Rider in November appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: New Shepard flight to demonstrate lunar gravity
summary:
Blue Origin’s next suborbital spaceflight will be a long-awaited demonstration of New Shepard’s ability to generate lunar gravity rather than microgravity.
The post New Shepard flight to demonstrate lunar gravity appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Rocket Lab, Orora Technologies contract for “responsive launch” ahead of main 2025 wildfire season
summary: The eight satellites will also fulfill a concept study contract awarded to OroraTech and Spire Global by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory in October 2024. A specific launch date hasn't been announced, but Rocket Lab said the Electron rocket launch would happen in “just a few weeks.”

title: NASA Invites Media to Expedition 71 Crew Visit at Marshall
summary: NASA will host four astronauts at 9 a.m. CDT Wednesday, Jan. 29, for a media opportunity at the agency’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama. NASA astronauts Matt Dominick, Mike Barratt, Jeanette Epps, and Tracy C. Dyson served as part of Expedition 71 and will discuss their recent missions to the International Space Station. […]

title: Fischer regains leadership of Senate Strategic Forces Subcommittee
summary:
Sen. Deb Fischer (R-Neb.) has been named chair of the Senate Armed Services’ subcommittee overseeing U.S. nuclear weapons and space programs

title: NASA Invites Media to Second Intuitive Machines Launch to Moon
summary: For the second time, Intuitive Machines will launch a lunar lander to deliver NASA technology demonstrations and science investigations to the Moon for the benefit of all. Media accreditation is open for the IM-2 launch, part of NASA’s CLPS (Commercial Lunar Payload Services) initiative and Artemis campaign to establish a long-term presence on the Moon.  […]
